author: revelar
title: Duo - (Alpha) - Mobile App
description: Mobile gamers are looking for access to NFT Games.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal tries to create a Duo, an NFT card-games, and a full play-to-earn model. Gaming is one of if not the fastest-growing sectors on blockchain application and social gameplay experiences like Duo will add great value to the Cardano ecosystem, especially in gaming space. The team has provided a functional website for the Duo game and has a pre-alpha version that can be played on discord. The proposal provides two main risks that they may face, Death by Success, and Software delays. However, the team has reasonably explained how they gonna mitigate those risks.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal provides clear milestones and a roadmap encompassing a 6-month timeline with 12x 2-week sprints. The team provides a breakdown of how they will use the proposed budget. However, based on talent.com data, the median salary of react native developers are ~62$/hour, and the experienced are ~80$/hour, meanwhile in the proposal remuneration for the lead react native developer is as high as 135$/hour. The high cost of the developer can be justified if the proposal elaborates more on the experience and workload of the engineer. The proposal give details information of background and experience of the team and also provides a LinkedIn profile for each member.
f6_assessments.q2: Metrics/KPIs for success are clearly defined by the launching of IOS and Android App with more than 200 Weekly active players during the PreAlpha beta, and more than 500 Weekly active players on average over the first 8 weeks after launch. The team also created a Catalyst Coordinator report as a way for the community to track and see the progress of the project.

f6_assessments.q0: Duo could be the next "flappy bird" of the blockchain gaming world. With a mobile app I believe we could bridge that gap of international adoption and bring more diversity to our blockchain. The lack of a 5th star is because you guys already have multiple proposals for this same game. I believe you should focus on one area or another and take it one step at a time as to not rush a product out to market that could fail as a result.
f6_assessments.q1: Strong team and strong product branding will carry you far. I love the simplicity of the game name and the game play. The fact you already have an alpha that is playable gives me great hopes that this game could be the next big thing in our ecosystem. The only thing I can suggest is to get your tokenomics solidified and released so you can drive more self-funding instead of coming to catalyst for multiple proposals.
f6_assessments.q2: On-chain metrics and video reporting, along with the release of an app on the google and iOS app stores are great ways to measure success. I am personally interested in giving this game a try for myself. This looks like something that anyone at any age could pick up and learn how to play. Kudos to the team at Revelar!

f6_assessments.q0:
I believe the project aligns with challenges from the following points:
- The main features, motivation and potential audience of the Duo project - (Alpha) - Mobile App has been described in detail by the author. Similar success examples are also included to increase the credibility of the project.
- The project can be measured by clear indicators such as the number of NFT's created for this game, new players onboarded,...
- The two main risks, software delays and death by success, are also clearly analyzed by the author and detailed solutions are given.
f6_assessments.q1:
I am quite impressed with the members of the project. The members have a lot of experience in the related fields. 
The information of project members is presented with full information including work experience, outstanding projects, and attached profiles LinkedIn, twitter, discord.
The plan is also meticulously elaborated and divided into 12 detailed sprints over 6 months.
The budget is divided quite reasonably in the items including the number of hours completed and the unit price per hour.
As a result, readers can more easily assess the feasibility of the project.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal presents audit information well so that the community can track project progress.
Readers can track project progress on the website: https://catalyst.revelar.co or Github tool every sprint (2 weeks).
The criteria to determine that the project has achieved its goals are also clearly described including quantitative KPIs after a specific time (8 weeks).

f6_assessments.q0: This task is a solution to convey duo sport to the Cardano blockchain. This will enrich the Cardano gaming industry. This falls precisely underneath the challenge's theme which is defined in element through the team. Such recreation can have a exquisite have an impact on on the ecosystem in phrases of embarking new customers and the scaling can in reality attain a excessive stage if the difficulty of excessive on-chain calculation hassle is resolved.
f6_assessments.q1: The crew is a very various and able one, they already have had more than one funded catalyst tasks before. The time body is explained in element and the price range is additionally described in detail.
f6_assessments.q2: The way how the venture was once divided into more than one milestone makes accountability an awful lot less difficult all through the development process. Furthermore, the roadmap is distinct however lacks a bit of technical facts that explains how such a mission will be concepted. The transport dates are truly described alongside future dates for more facets and more.

solution: We want to build a mobile native app (iOS & Android) for Duo’s Alpha Launch.
experience: The Revelar team is a known contributor & has been received funding on several projects in previous Catalyst Funds. Duo is our flagship game and with over 130+ days of preAlpha gameplay it’s a game people love!
